publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5532 Donald Gorrie: Shadow Round for European Funding—That the Parliament expresses concern that over 50 small voluntary sector organisations are being excluded from applying to the recently announced shadow round for European funding in the current year because an arbitrary £200,000 minimum project size has been introduced by ministers; believes that this decision is contrary to the stated policies of the Scottish Executive to encourage and develop the voluntary sector, and asks the Executive to reconsider the decision.
S2M-5532 Shadow Round for European Funding (lodged on 2 February 2007) Robin Harper*, Mike Pringle* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-5532 Shadow Round for European Funding (lodged on 2 February 2007) John Swinburne*, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-5532 Shadow Round for European Funding (lodged on 2 February 2007) Nora Radcliffe*, Frances Curran*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5532 Shadow Round for European Funding (lodged on 2 February 2007) Shiona Baird*
S2M-5532 Shadow Round for European Funding (lodged on 2 February 2007) Chris Ballance* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J

S2M-5532 Donald Gorrie: Shadow Round for European Funding—That the Parliament expresses concern that over 50 small voluntary sector organisations are being excluded from applying to the recently announced shadow round for European funding in the current year because an arbitrary £200,000 minimum project size has been introduced by ministers; believes that this decision is contrary to the stated policies of the Scottish Executive to encourage and develop the voluntary sector, and asks the Executive to reconsider the decision. Supported by: Robin Harper, Mike Pringle, John Swinburne, Dennis Canavan, Nora Radcliffe, Frances Curran, Dr Jean Turner, Shiona Baird, Chris Ballance
